column4: But separate, so I can reinstall either OS if I screw something up....
So technically, it is another partition altogether, actually.
Is there any way to remount my data partition so that I can execute .jar files, perchance?
Oh, I was trying to do something else, come to think of it. x__x... I was trying to "open with..." Java Sun VM. But it doesn't work for the terminal command.
Says "Failed to load Main-Class manifest attribute"
Attempting to change the file to be executable from the properties window does not work. It unchecks it as soon as I check it.
It works fine on my linux partition. I doubt Java is the problem.

.__. ... I'd have to move a lot of files to my linux partition, which is supposed to be big enough for just linux essentials, then keep most programs on the third partition. Am I going to have to redo my setup?
It is still on the separate partition.
That is, I have a Windows partition and a Data partition, the latter being where I keep anything I want to use with both Linux and Windows. ^^;;;;
is the file stored on an NTFS partition?
if its NTFS then you will need to make the partition mark all the files executable when it's mounted
you can add it so that it mounts with those options at boot, you will need to create a new folder to mount to
why not copy the app to your linux partition?
I'd ask in #bash  they got mad skills
wget should be able to do that
